tier.item: `That pig, he shot (it).' ~ `That pig was shot by him.'3
That pig, he shot (it).' ~ `That pig was shot by him.'3
(18) Ata laki va a, pana le nata-gu.
Ata laki va a, pana le nata-gu.
person male that go PREP village-1GEN
That man(,) went to our village.
(19) Ata laki va a, ia pana le nata-gu.
`That man, he went to our village.'
Ata laki va a, ia pana le nata-gu.
person male that 3SG go PREP village-1GEN
That man, he went to our village.
He went to our village yesterday.
(25) Ata laki va a, pana le nata-gu vaicvi.
person male that go PREP village-1GEN yesterday
`That man(,) went to our village yesterday.'
Ata laki va a, pana le nata-gu vaicvi.
person male that go PREP village-1GEN yesterday
That man(,) went to our village yesterday.
`He looked for us.' (or ~ `We were looked for by him.')
He looked for us.' (or ~ `We were looked for by him.')
Clause with two core arguments and one adjunct (locative)
`He chopped the wood in the garden.'
Clause with two core arguments and one adjunct (locative)
He chopped the wood in the garden.
(36) Ia bere kaju no o tobo.
`He chopped the wood with a machete.'
Ia bere kaju no o tobo.
He chopped the wood with a machete.
(37) Aku pana lau Todo no o ina-gu.
`I went to Todo with my mother.'
Aku pana lau Todo no o ina-gu.
I went to Todo with my mother.
(42) No o ina-gu, aku pana lau Todo.
`With my mother, I went to Todo .'
No o ina-gu, aku pana lau Todo.
With my mother, I went to Todo .
(43) Lau Todo, aku pana no o ina-gu.
`To Todo, I went with my mother.'
Lau Todo, aku pana no o ina-gu.
To Todo, I went with my mother.
`All of my younger brothers and sisters are sitting down.'
All of my younger brothers and sisters are sitting down.
(49) Konen pana le nua va a teti ón.
`All of them went to that/those village(s).'
* `They went to all of those villages.'
Konen pana le nua va a teti ón.
All of them went to that/those village(s).
* `They went to all of those villages.
(50) Konen bere somu va a teti ón.
Konen bere somu va a teti ón.
They chopped all of that garlic.' ~
All of them chopped that garlic
(51) Konen bere somu no o kti va a teti ón.
3PL chop garlic with knife that all
`All of them chopped the garlic with those knives.' OR
`They chopped all of the garlic with those knives.'
* `they chopped the garlic with all of those knives'
Konen bere somu no o kti va a teti ón.
3PL chop garlic with knife that all
All of them chopped the garlic with those knives.' OR
They chopped all of the garlic with those knives.
* `they chopped the garlic with all of those knives
`They chopped all of the garlic.' ~ `The garlic was all chopped by them.'
They chopped all of the garlic.' ~ `The garlic was all chopped by them.
(53) Konen(-konen) va a pana-naba le nata-nata teti ón.
* `all of them went to the villages'
Konen(-konen) va a pana-naba le nata-nata teti ón.
They went to all the villages.
* `all of them went to the villages
(56) Konen va a pana le nata teti ón.
* `they went to all of the villages'
Konen va a pana le nata teti ón.
They all went to the villages.
* `they went to all of the villages
(57) Konen va a ka-naba ke o-ke o teti ón.
Konen va a ka-naba ke o-ke o teti ón.
(58) Konen bere-naba lambu-lambu no o kti(-kti) teti ón.
`They cut all the cloth with knives.' ~
`They cut the cloth with all of the knives.'
Konen bere-naba lambu-lambu no o kti(-kti) teti ón.
They cut all the cloth with knives.' ~
They cut the cloth with all of the knives.
(59) Ke o(-ke o) konen va a ka-naba teti ón.
Ke o(-ke o) konen va a ka-naba teti ón.
(60) Aku pula lae nua lka __ nodo le kandera.
1SG return PREP house and.then sit chair
`Ij came back home, and then Øj sat down.'
Aku pula lae nua lka __ nodo le kandera.
1SG return PREP house and.then sit PREP chair
Ij came back home, and then Øj sat down.
(61) Ama-gu pana le uma lka __ take rero-n.
father-1GEN return PREP garden and.then meet friend-3GEN
`My fatherj went to the garden, and then Ø j met his friend.'
Ama-gu pana le uma lka __ take rero-n.
father-1GEN return PREP garden and.then meet friend-3GEN
My fatherj went to the garden, and then Ø j met his friend.
(62) Ama-gu kla kaju lka __ pula lae nua.
father-1GEN split wood and.then return PREP house
`My fatherj split some wood, and then Øj returned home.'
Ama-gu kla kaju lka __ pula lae nua.
father-1GEN split wood and.then return PREP house
My fatherj split some wood, and then Øj returned home.
`My fatherj met my motherk, and then Øj/*k sat down.'
My fatherj met my motherk, and then Øj/*k sat down.
(64) Aku ia balu lka __ palu lae nua-n.
`Hej hit mek, and then Øk returned to his house.'
* `Hej hit mek, and then (hej) returned to his house.'
Aku ia balu lka __ palu lae nua-n.
Hej hit mek, and then Øk returned to his house.
* `Hej hit mek, and then (hej) returned to his house.
(65) Ia balu aku lka __ palu lae nua-n.
* `He hit me, and then I returned to his house.'
`He hit me, and then (hej) returned to his house.'
Ia balu aku lka __ palu lae nua-n.
* `He hit me, and then I returned to his house.
He hit me, and then (hej) returned to his house.
(66) Ina lo o-gu ia pela lka __ mea- u.
`Hei watched my auntj, and then (she ) got embarrassed.'
* `Hei watched my auntj and then Øi got embarrassed.'
Ina lo o-gu ia pela lka __ mea-u.
Hei watched my auntj, and then (she ) got embarrassed.
* `Hei watched my auntj and then Øi got embarrassed.
(67) Ama lo o-de ia pela lka __ kau ia.
`Hei watched my unclej, and then (hej ) got angry with himi.'
* `Hei watched my unclej and then Øi got angry with himj.'
Ama lo o-de ia pela lka __ kau ia.
Hei watched my unclej, and then (hej ) got angry with himi.
* `Hei watched my unclej and then Øi got angry with himj.
`He got up in order to go.'
He got up in order to go.
(69) Ke o-gu pana le Cua tene
`My elder brother went to Cua in order to look for a shaman.'
Ke o-gu pana le Cua tene
My elder brother went to Cua in order to look for a shaman.
(70) Ke o-gu pana le Cua tene
`My elder brother went to Cua in order for a shaman to heal him.'
Ke o-gu pana le Cua tene
My elder brother went to Cua in order for a shaman to heal him.
(71) Ke ogu pana le Cua tene [ __ ata pisa-n-e ravi ].
`My elder brother went to Cua in order for to be healed by a shaman.'
Ke ogu pana le Cua tene [ __ ata pisa-n-e ravi ].
My elder brother went to Cua in order for to be healed by a shaman.
(72) Ke ogu pana le Cua tene [ ata pisa-n-e ravi __ ].
`My elder brother went to Cua in order for a shaman to heal (him).'
Ke ogu pana le Cua tene [ ata pisa-n-e ravi __ ].
My elder brother went to Cua in order for a shaman to heal (him).
`Hei shot the pig in order (for Øi) to die.'
* `He shot the pig in order for it to die.'
Hei shot the pig in order (for Øi) to die.
* `He shot the pig in order for it to die.
* `He shot the pig in order to die.'
`He shot the pig in order for it to die.'
* `He shot the pig in order to die.
He shot the pig in order for it to die.
`Myself, I chopped.' ~ `Myself was chopped by me.'11
Myself, I chopped.' ~ `Myself was chopped by me.'11
`I, myself chopped.' ~ `I was chopped by myself'
I, myself chopped.' ~ `I was chopped by myself
`I ate that rice.' ~ `That rice was eaten by me.'
I ate that rice.' ~ `That rice was eaten by me.
(95) Vavi va a coma cube lka __ laju lae uta.
pig that affect shoot and.then run bush
`That pig was shot and then ran to the bush.'
Vavi va a coma cube lka __ laju lae uta.
pig that affect shoot and.then run PREP bush
That pig was shot and then ran to the bush.
